marketNews.title: BBRI 5M25: Bank Only Net Profit -15% YoY
marketNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI) reported bank only net profit of 3.6 trillion rupiah in May 2025 (-11% YoY, -7% MoM). This result brought the bank only net profit for 5M25 to 18.6 trillion rupiah (-15% YoY), which is relatively lower compared to the consensus expectation which projected a consolidated net profit for 2025F to decline by -3% YoY.

marketNews.title: NII Trend Improving
marketNews.content: Net Interest Income (NII) only slightly decreased by -1% YoY during 5M25. This result improved compared to the 3M25 realization at -5% YoY, driven by improvements in both Interest Income and Interest Expense. Both were relatively flat (-1% YoY) during 5M25, compared to the 3M25 realization which dropped around 3-4% YoY. The improved Interest Income trend is in line with credit growth which reached +5% YoY as of May 2025, compared to +4% YoY as of March 2025, although it remains below management's consolidated target for 2025 in the range of +7-9% (after adjusting bank only vs consolidated). Net Interest Margin (NIM) was still weak at 6.17% in May 2025, resulting in a NIM for 5M25 at 6.38% (vs 5M24: 6.48%), which we assess is still in line with management's consolidated target for 2025 (after adjusting bank only vs consolidated).

marketNews.title: Non-II and Provisions Deteriorate
marketNews.content: The improving NII trend was not reflected in the Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) which fell -9% YoY during 5M25, compared to -6% YoY during 3M25. This was caused by the weakening of Non-Interest Income (Non-II) in April-May 2025. Non-II in the last 2 months reached only 3.8 trillion rupiah and 3.6 trillion rupiah, smaller than the January-March 2025 levels which were around 4.1-4.2 trillion rupiah per month, due to lower profits from 'trading' and 'others'. Meanwhile, provision expenses and Cost of Credit (CoC) rose to 3.4 trillion rupiah and 3.24% in May 2025, marking a two-month consecutive increase since March 2025. This realization caused provision expenses during 5M25 to reach 17.7 trillion rupiah (-1% YoY), with CoC at 3.46%, which we assess is still above management's consolidated target for 2025 in the range of 3-3.2% (after adjusting bank only vs consolidated).

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: We assess that BBRI's net profit achievement against consensus expectations requires a significant recovery in 2H25, although we still see potential for downward revisions to the 2025F net profit estimate from consensus following the -2/-12% cuts in the last 3/6 months. From a valuation perspective, BBRI is trading at 1.7x 1-Year Forward P/BV as of Monday (30/6), nearly at -2 Standard Deviations (1.6x) below the 5-year historical average. We also see BBRI offering a minimum dividend yield potential of 7.5%.

marketNews.title: Constitutional Court Decides to Separate National and Local Elections
marketNews.content: The Constitutional Court on Thursday (26/6) decided to separate the organization of national elections and local elections. With this decision, future elections will be held in 2 stages. The national election to elect members of the DPR, DPD, and president and vice president will be held first. After a 2-2.5 year hiatus, the local election will then be held to elect members of the DPRD, governors, as well as regents and mayors.

marketNews.title: Indonesia to Ease Import Restrictions Ahead of US Tariff Deadline
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that the Indonesian government will ease restrictions and regulations related to imports, including the removal of import licensing requirements for certain goods and the exemption of some industrial raw materials from the import restriction list. Reuters mentioned that although government officials did not specifically state that this plan is related to tariff negotiations with the US, the discussion arose ahead of the July 9, 2025 deadline for tariff negotiations with the US. These import simplifications will affect 10 commodity groups - including fertilizer, forestry, and plastic products - and are planned to start taking effect within the next 2 months.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Offers US Investment Opportunities in Critical Minerals
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for the Economy, Airlangga Hartarto, stated that the Indonesian government has offered the US an opportunity to invest in critical mineral projects as part of the tariff negotiations. Airlangga mentioned that BPI Danantara will also be involved in the offered projects.

marketNews.title: Cepu Block Achieves Additional Oil Production
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, claimed that the Cepu oil and gas block has recorded an additional oil production of 30,000 barrels per day, reaching 180,000 barrels per day. The government itself targets oil lifting in 2025 to reach 605,000 barrels per day, although the realization during 5M25 only reached 567,900 barrels per day (vs 2024 realization: 579,700 barrels per day).

marketNews.title: OJK Officially Postpones Health Insurance Co-payment Policy Implementation
marketNews.content: OJK has officially postponed the implementation of the co-payment policy for health insurance products, which was previously scheduled to take effect on January 1, 2026. This decision was made following the results of a joint meeting with Commission XI of the DPR on Monday (30/6).

tickerNews.title: NCKL Increases Stake in HPAL Smelter Worth IDR 4.2 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Trimegah Bangun Persada purchased a 20% stake in PT Obi Nickel Cobalt from the company's controller, PT Harita Jayaraya, for 4.2 trillion rupiah. NCKL stated that this transaction was carried out because the company sees promising business development potential at PT Obi Nickel Cobalt. After this transaction, NCKL's ownership in PT Obi Nickel Cobalt increased from 20% to 40%, while the remainder (60%) is owned by Lygend New Power (Hong Kong) Limited. PT Obi Nickel Cobalt itself is an HPAL smelter that operates 3 mixed hydroxide precipitate production lines, with an installed capacity of 65,000 tons of nickel content and 7,500 tons of cobalt content per year.

tickerNews.title: FILM Plans Rights Issue to Pay Down Debt to BMRI
tickerNews.content: MD Entertainment ($FILM) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to ~989.8 million new shares at an exercise price of 800 rupiah per share, with a 10:1 ratio, resulting in a dilution effect of up to 9.09%. The potential proceeds from this corporate action reach approximately 791.8 billion rupiah, which will be allocated for principal debt repayment to Bank Mandiri ($BMRI) and working capital. PT Samuel International and PT Samuel Sekuritas Indonesia will act as standby buyers. PT MD Corp Enterprises, as the controller of FILM, will transfer all its rights to Manoj Dhamoo Punjabi and the South Korean media company, SBS Co. Ltd. After the rights issue, SBS Co. Ltd. - as a new investor - will hold a 3.8% stake in FILM. The rights trading period runs from July 10-18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Joint Venture Partners Groundbreak US$6 Billion Electric Vehicle Battery Plant
tickerNews.content: The joint venture owned by Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd., Indonesia Battery Corp., and Aneka Tambang ($ANTM) conducted a groundbreaking ceremony for an integrated electric vehicle battery plant in Karawang, West Java, on Sunday (29/6). Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that the US$6 billion plant will produce battery cells with a capacity of up to 15 GWh, capable of generating electricity for 250,000-300,000 cars. The initial phase of this project is targeted for completion by the end of 2026, with an initial capacity of 6.9 GWh.

tickerNews.title: New Controller of DATA Plans Mandatory Tender Offer
tickerNews.content: The new controller of Remala Abadi and a subsidiary of Sarana Menara Nusantara ($TOWR), PT Iforte Solusi Infotek, plans to conduct a mandatory tender offer for up to ~275 million (20%) shares of DATA at an offer price of 974 rupiah per share during the period of July 1-30, 2025. This mandatory tender offer was conducted after PT Iforte Solusi Infotek acquired a 40% stake in DATA at a price of 974 rupiah per share, totaling 535.7 billion rupiah in April 2025.

tickerNews.title: HEAL President Director Buys Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller and President Director of Medikaloka Hermina ($HEAL), Hasmoro, purchased approximately 1.5 million HEAL shares at a price of 1,365 rupiah per share on June 20, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Hasmoro's direct ownership in HEAL increased from approximately 4.8% to approximately 4.81%.

tickerNews.title: CDIA: Abundant Cash, Inorganic Expansion Makes Perfect Sense
tickerNews.content: Inorganic expansion makes sense because infrastructure projects are generally not financed with 100% cash, and the last 2 companies of Prajogo Pangestu (CUAN & BREN) acquired companies after their IPO.
